preConditions.onFailMessage: Ignored CreateTable for SCHEDULEDASSIGNMENT as table already exists.

createTable.remarks: A scheduled assignment

column.name: LOAD_STATE
column.remarks: The required load state for this scheduled assignment.

column.name: REASON
column.remarks: The reason for this scheduled assignment.

column.name: EXPECTEDARRIVALTIME_UTC
column.remarks: The time at which the truck is expected to arrive at the destination after activation. NULL means that this has yet to be activated.

column.name: ARRIVEAFTERTIME_UTC
column.remarks: This is the time that the truck must be assigned to arrive after. The truck must not be sent to arrive at the destination before this time. NULL means that this is ignored.

column.name: NEXTSCHEDULEDASSIGNMENT
column.remarks: This points to the next scheduled assignment for stacked manual assignments. This value is null when there is no next scheduled assignment.

column.name: STATUS
column.remarks: The status of this scheduled assignment. "A" - Active. "D" - At Destination. "F" - Finished. "I" - Inactive. Scheduled assignments are created 'Inactive', become 'Active' on the assignment, become 'At Destination' when they arrive, then are 'Finished' when the truck leaves the selected destination or ends the on arrival delay.

column.name: ASAP
column.remarks: When true means that the truck must arrive as soon as possible AFTER the notBefore time. When this is false the truck must arrive as late as possible BEFORE the requiredArrivalTime.

column.name: RESCHEDULE
column.remarks: When this is true the scheduled manual assignment is not deleted when completed, but is appended to the end of the current list of scheduled manual assignments for the truck. When this is true the normal scheduled assignment is re-created to require the truck to arrive reschedulePeriod time in the future.

column.name: ARRIVEBEFORETIME_UTC
column.remarks: This is the time that the truck must be assigned to arrive before. The truck must not be sent to arrive at the destination after this time. The scheduled assignment is finished when it is no longer possible to assign the truck to arrive at the destination before this time. NULL means that this is ignored.

column.name: TRUCK
column.remarks: The target truck to be assigned.

column.name: RESCHEDULEPERIOD
column.remarks: This is only used when reschedule is set to true. It is added to the requiredArrivalTime to create the new requiredArrivalTime.

column.name: PREVIOUSSCHEDULEDASSIGNMENT
column.remarks: This points to the previous scheduled assignment for stacked manual assignments. This value is null when there is no previous scheduled assignment.

column.name: ACTIVATIONTIME_UTC
column.remarks: The time when this scheduled assignment was activated. NULL means that this has yet to be activated.

column.name: TYPE
column.remarks: This can be set by anyone creating the scheduled assignment for filtering purposes.

column.name: PURPOSE
column.remarks: This can be set by anyone creating the scheduled assignment for filtering purposes.

column.name: CREATOR
column.remarks: The person responsible for the creation of this scheduled assignment.

column.name: CREATIONTIME_UTC
column.remarks: The time when this scheduled assignment was created.

column.name: MANUAL
column.remarks: When true means that this is a manual scheduled assignment.

column.name: ARRIVEREQUIREDTIME_UTC
column.remarks: The time when the truck should be at the destination. The truck will be assigned to arrive at or before this time if possible. The truck may be assigned to arrive after this time in exceptional circumstances. NULL means that this is a manual scheduled assignment.

column.name: MATERIAL
column.remarks: The material that is to be loaded at the destination. When null it means that the truck should dump.

column.name: ONARRIVALDELAY
column.remarks: The delay that is associated with the trucks arrival at the destination. This is null when there is no associated delay.

column.name: ONASSIGNMENTDELAY
column.remarks: The delay that is associated with the assignment to the destination. This is null when there is no associated delay.

column.name: ONARRIVALDELAYTYPE
column.remarks: The type of delay that is associated with the trucks arrival at the destination. This is null when there is no associated delay.

column.name: ONARRIVALDELAYTYPEPROD
column.remarks: When this is true the delay that is associated with the trucks arrival at the destination is created as a production reporting delay only and is ignored by Assignment.

column.name: ONASSIGNMENTDELAYTYPE
column.remarks: The type of delay that is associated with the assignment to the destination. This is null when there is no associated delay.

column.name: ONASSIGNMENTDELAYPROD
column.remarks: When this is true the delay that is associated with the assignment to the destination is created as a production reporting delay only and is ignored by Assignment.

column.name: DURATION
column.remarks: The time the truck is expected to spend at the destination after arrival. ZERO means that this is not known.

column.name: ACTIVATION_LOCATION
column.remarks: The location where this scheduled assignment was made when it was activated.

column.name: ACTIVATION_MACHINE
column.remarks: The machine where this scheduled assignment was made when it was activated.
